column4: when i ls a file it exists, but when i run it the response is that the file doesn't exist
i have 755 on the file, owned by me
i once had the same problem with a little 32bit programm which i tried to run on 64bit computer. maybe that is the problem?
i'm trying to install the intel compilers v 11.1
but they distribute the ia64 version of this helper program in the intel64 package but they use the 32bit one
and i just need the frakin' libs
well, if it really is the problem, you can do nothing but get a 64bit version
or i think there was some lib for 32bit programms in 64bit, never used it though

jamed: it's just annoying this is all suppose to be supported:-\
i just looked it up: the package linux32 is for 32bit support, but if you run hardy or newer it is already preinstalled, so if it doesnt work now, you can do nothing
